data.title: Obituary for Robert O. Benzon
meta_keywords: Vandemore Funeral Homes and Cremation Services
data.meta_description: Robert O. “Bob” Benzon, 98, of Geneseo passed away Saturday, June 21, 2014, at Hillcrest Home of Geneseo.  A memorial service celebrating Bob’s life will be held at 10:30 a.m. Saturday, June 28, 2014, at Vandemore Funeral Home, Geneseo.  Reverend Susan...
data.text:
Robert O. “Bob” Benzon, 98, of Geneseo passed away Saturday, June 21, 2014, at Hillcrest Home of Geneseo. A memorial service celebrating Bob’s life will be held at 10:30 a.m. Saturday, June 28, 2014, at Vandemore Funeral Home, Geneseo. Reverend Susan Cripe-Benzon will officiate. Cremation rites have been accorded and a private inurnment will be in Oakwood Cemetery, Geneseo. A memorial visitation will be held one hour prior to the service (9:30-10:30 a.m.) Saturday at Vandemore Funeral Home. In lieu of flowers, memorials may be left to a favorite charity of the donor’s choice.

Bob was born March 21, 1916, in Moline, IL, the son of Peter and Selma (Freeburg) Benzon. As a young man, Bob lived in Tiskilwa, IL, Stanton, IA and Andover, IL. He was a 1933 graduate of Cambridge High School and 1937 graduate of Augustana College in Rock Island, IL. Bob enlisted in the US Air Force in World War II. He married Marilyn Norcross on June 1, 1946, in Orion, IL. After the war, he was a farm manager, manufacturing company representative, plant superintendent and retired as manager of Beatrice Foods, Inc. Con Agra Products plant in Omaha, NE. In 1976, he was listed in Who’s Who in Nebraska with a special comment from President Gerald Ford.

Bob was or had been a member of the American Legion, life member of the Disabled American Veterans, 32 degree Mason, Shriner, charter member of the Valley View Club in Cambridge, coached and taught at the high school level, was active in Little League Baseball, was a Sunday School teacher and active in church organizations. Bob currently was a member of First Lutheran Church in Geneseo.

Survivors include his wife, Marilyn; son, Dr. Steven Benzon (Reverend Sue Cripe Benzon) of Delvan, WI; daughter, Sally Ann Benzon, Geneseo; six grandchildren, Amanda (Chris) Mull, David (Ann) Benzon, Peter Benzon, Andrew Benzon, John Benzon, Robert Benzon; three great-grandchildren, Alayna, Alyssa, and Alex Mull; and several nieces and nephews.

Bob was preceded in death by his parents, three sisters, Mildred Lundin, Linnea Swanson, and Betty Zelnio, two brothers, Harold Benzon and Colonel Paul Benzon and great-granddaughter, Selena Mull.
